main_definition: Marriott is a brand name of several luxury hotel chains, but it can also be used as an idiom or slang to describe someone who is well-off and indulges in comforts.

meanings_and_examples.example: I booked my stay at a Marriott hotel for my business trip.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Well-off person or someone who indulges in comforts
meanings_and_examples.example: After receiving his bonus, he went on an extravagant vacation to a resort owned by Marriott.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A nickname for the Marquis of Mantua from Shakespeare's play 'Romeo and Juliet'
meanings_and_examples.example: In some cultures, referring to someone as 'Marriott' is a humorous way of saying they have an air of nobility or refinement.
